meanings.definition: To increase in size or amount
meanings.sent1: Plants grow taller when they get more sunlight.
meanings.sent2: I hope my savings will grow over time.
meanings.sent3: The cake seemed to grow bigger every time I looked at it!
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to grow brighter with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the room seemed to grow louder and louder.

meanings.sent1: Children grow stronger as they play and exercise.
meanings.sent2: I can see our friendship grow stronger with each conversation.
meanings.sent3: His patience seemed to grow longer as he waited for the bus.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence began to grow like a seed blossoming into a flower.
meanings.sent5: The bond between them continued to grow deeper and more meaningful.

meanings.sent1: Farmers grow crops to feed the community.
meanings.sent2: She worked hard to grow her business from a small shop to a successful company.
meanings.sent3: The idea in his mind started to grow like a tiny seed in fertile soil.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for painting began to grow like a beautiful garden in spring.
meanings.sent5: The love and care she put into her work seemed to grow with each project.

meanings.definition: To become larger or mature in a natural way
meanings.sent1: Children grow taller as they get older.
meanings.sent2: The puppy will grow into a big dog in a few months.
meanings.sent3: His curiosity seemed to grow bigger as he explored the museum.
meanings.sent4: The small acorn will grow into a mighty oak tree one day.
meanings.sent5: The friendship between the two neighbors continued to grow stronger over the years.
